Step 1:firstly, in a cooker heat oil / butter. using more oil makes dhaba style chole masala.

 Step 2: furthermore, saute bay leaf, cinnamon stick and cumin seeds till they turn aromatic. also add finely chopped onions and ginger-garlic paste. saute till it turns golden brown.

 Step 3: add tomatoes and saute till they start releasing oil.

 Step 4:further, add chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder, cumin powder, aamchur powder, garam masala and salt. saute for a minute. then add soaked chickpea / canned chickpea. make sure to soak chickpea overnight if its not canned chickpea.

 Step 5: further add 2 cups of water. add more water if you like it to be more gravy.

 give a good mix. and check the seasonings. make sure the masala water to be slightly salty as chole will absorb while cooking.

 Step 6: pressure cook for 7-8 whistles on medium flame allow the pressure to release by itself before opening cooker.

 Step 7: squeeze lemon and mix well. garnish with coriander leaves.

 Step 8: finally, serve hot with poori / chapathi / bhatura.
